full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 125 of 261 1286 LC6VMAX4

1 MS. STERNHEIM: Excuse me. I'm getting another --
2 K-8. I apologize.
3 THE COURT: Okay. Defendant's K-8.
4 So just get my head back in it.
5 Okay. Ms. Pomerantz?
6 MS. POMERANTZ: Your Honor, may I just have a moment.
7 THE COURT: Okay.
8 (Counsel conferred)
9 MS. POMERANTZ: If I could have just the 3500 number
10 so that way -- because I don't believe I have the exhibit.
11 MS. STERNHEIM: 3513-019.
12 THE COURT: I don't think I ever got a copy of it. It
13 was on the screen.
14 MS. POMERANTZ: Yes.
15 THE COURT: If it's not in the binder, maybe you could
16 hand up a copy, please.
17 MS. STERNHEIM: I can, Judge.
18 THE COURT: Thank you.
19 MS. STERNHEIM: I'm just showing the government.
20 THE COURT: Yes.
21 MS. POMERANTZ: Your Honor, the recorded recollection
22 rule provides an exception to the rule against hearsay. And
23 the first prong refers to: On a matter that the witness once
24 knew about, but now cannot recall well enough to testify fully
25 and accurately.

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00018462
